Directories and GitHub reposÂ¶

Setting up the following directory structure, and cloning these repos, will make it easier to follow the tutorials provided in this documentation. These paths can be changed to whatever you like, just be sure to update the examples accordingly.

  1. Setup what will become our top working directory ~/flatiron
mkdir flatiron
cd flatiron
mkdir maf_local
mkdir my_repos
mkdir -p opsimv4_data/run_local/output
  1. Clone the following repos into these directories
cd maf_local
git clone https://github.com/LSST-nonproject/sims_maf_contrib.git
cd ..
cd my_repos
git clone https://github.com/lsst/sims_maf.git
git clone https://github.com/lsst-ts/scheduler_config
git clone git clone https://github.com/lsst/sims_featureScheduler.git

3. If you are on a linux system you will need to open up the read/write permissions of any of the local directories that will be mounted inside of docker containers. The for these tutorials you will need to do this for maf_local, my_repos, and run_local. Again, please see this link for additional setup steps for using docker on linux.

chmod a+rw maf_local
chmod a+rw my_repos
chmod a+rw opsimv4_data
